mention.text: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi denied on Monday that he was anti-German , after he caused outrage at the weekend by suggesting Germany did not acknowledge the existence of Nazi concentration camps
Schulz , whom he once compared to a concentration camp overseer , as unfriendly to Italy
a comment he had made about Martin Schulz , a German who is president of the European Parliament and the center left 's candidate
Forza Italia , called on Berlusconi to withdraw his remarks about concentration camps , saying he was disgusted by them
the European People 's Party , the center-right group that includes Forza Italia , called on Berlusconi to withdraw his remarks about concentration camps , saying he was disgusted by them
the center-right group that includes Forza Italia , called on Berlusconi to withdraw his remarks about concentration camps , saying he was disgusted by them
the candidate for European Commission chief
